sap.ui.vk.tools.ScaleTool.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ScaleTool. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getCoordinateSystem coordinateSystem} : sap.ui.vk.tools.CoordinateSystem (default: World)
    • {@link #getNonUniformScaleEnabled nonUniformScaleEnabled} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableStepping enableStepping} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableSnapping enableSnapping} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowEditingUI showEditingUI} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAutoResetValues autoResetValues} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAllowContextMenu allowContextMenu} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getNodeSet nodeSet} : sap.ui.vk.tools.ToolNodeSet (default: Highlight)
    • {@link #getPlacementMode placementMode} : sap.ui.vk.tools.GizmoPlacementMode (default: Default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:scaling scaling} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:scaled scaled} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:coordinateSystemChanged coordinateSystemChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:placementModeChanged placementModeChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool#constructor sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool} can be used as well.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

gizmo.description: sap.ui.vk.tools.Gizmo owned by this control and used for rendering floating UI
gizmo.helpDescription: sap.ui.vk.tools.Gizmo owned by this control and used for rendering floating UI

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

This event contains parameter 'nodesProperties' that is array of objects, each object has four properties: {any} node: node reference, {float[]} offsetToRest, scale relative to rest position in local coordinates {float[]} offsetToPrevious, scale relative to end position of previous sequence or rest position if no previous sequence in local coordinates {float[]} absolute, scale in parent coordinates {float[]} world, scale in world coordinate {float[]} restDifference, change of rest position scale in ratio in parent coordinates {float[]} restDifferenceInCoordinates, change of rest position scale in ratio in current coordinates

sap.ui.vk.ContentResource.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ContentResource. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSource source} : any
    • {@link #getSourceType sourceType} : string
    • {@link #getSourceId sourceId} : string
    • {@link #getLocalMatrix localMatrix} : float[]
    • {@link #getName name} : string
    • {@link #getPassword password} : string
    • {@link #getUseSecureConnection useSecureConnection} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getVeid veid} : string
    • {@link #getIncludeHidden includeHidden} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getIncludeAnimation includeAnimation} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getPushPMI pushPMI} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getMetadataFilter metadataFilter} : string
    • {@link #getActivateView activateView} : string
    • {@link #getEnableLogger enableLogger} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getPushViewGroups pushViewGroups} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getIncludeBackground includeBackground} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getIncludeParametric includeParametric} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getIncludeMetadata includeMetadata} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIncludeUsageId includeUsageId} : sap.ui.vk.IncludeUsageIdType (default: false)
    • {@link #getDependencyLoader dependencyLoader} : any
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContentResources contentResources} : sap.ui.vk.ContentResource[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor sap.ui.base.ManagedObject} can be used as well.

sourceId.description: The unique ID of the content resource.
sourceId.helpDescription: The unique ID of the content resource.

enableLogger.description: Optional boolean parameter to enable detailed logging. Can be used to track performance issues during data streaming from SAP 3D Visualization Service.
enableLogger.helpDescription: Optional boolean parameter to enable detailed logging. Can be used to track performance issues during data streaming from SAP 3D Visualization Service.

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

useSecureConnection.description: If set to false, unsecure connections will be used. Default: true.
useSecureConnection.helpDescription: If set to false, unsecure connections will be used. Default: true.

source.description: The source URL or the {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/File File} object of the content resource/file to load from. The source may be omitted if a grouping node is needed.
source.helpDescription: The source URL or the {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/File File} object of the content resource/file to load from. The source may be omitted if a grouping node is needed.

dependencyLoader.description: An object used to load content resource's dependencies. A content resource may have dependencies, e.g. if the loaded content resource is a shattered VDS file it reference other VDS files. dependencyLoader should be an object with method function load(uri: string, context: any): Promise<{buffer: ArrayBuffer, context: any}>, where uri is a reference to a dependency and context is opaque data. uri is application specific and can be a full URL or a relative file name or anything else, e.g. some identifier known to dependencyLoader.
dependencyLoader.helpDescription: An object used to load content resource's dependencies. A content resource may have dependencies, e.g. if the loaded content resource is a shattered VDS file it reference other VDS files. dependencyLoader should be an object with method function load(uri: string, context: any): Promise<{buffer: ArrayBuffer, context: any}>, where uri is a reference to a dependency and context is opaque data. uri is application specific and can be a full URL or a relative file name or anything else, e.g. some identifier known to dependencyLoader.

pushViewGroups.description: If set to true, information of view groups will be returned. Default: true.
pushViewGroups.helpDescription: If set to true, information of view groups will be returned. Default: true.

metadataFilter.description: Optional metadata filter that can trim the tree before sending to the client only keeping nodes that passed the filter and their parents. Default: null. Format: Comma-separated list of meta.category1.tag1.value1, meta.category2.tag2.value2. "meta." is the prefix and all metadata filters must start with it. Multiple filters are supported, they are combined using `OR` operator. Includes parent nodes of matching nodes (e.g. breadcrumb) even if they don't pass the filter.
metadataFilter.helpDescription: Optional metadata filter that can trim the tree before sending to the client only keeping nodes that passed the filter and their parents. Default: null. Format: Comma-separated list of meta.category1.tag1.value1, meta.category2.tag2.value2. "meta." is the prefix and all metadata filters must start with it. Multiple filters are supported, they are combined using `OR` operator. Includes parent nodes of matching nodes (e.g. breadcrumb) even if they don't pass the filter.

includeMetadata.description: If set to true, will load metadata
includeMetadata.helpDescription: If set to true, will load metadata

password.description: The password to use when opening the resource.
password.helpDescription: The password to use when opening the resource.

includeHidden.description: Send structural data for hidden objects, if false they will be omitted, reducing data size. Default: true.
includeHidden.helpDescription: Send structural data for hidden objects, if false they will be omitted, reducing data size. Default: true.

includeBackground.description: If set to true, will return nodes with the type background
includeBackground.helpDescription: If set to true, will return nodes with the type background

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link topic:91f2d03b6f4d1014b6dd926db0e91070 Configuration Options and URL Parameters}.

includeUsageId.description:
Optional parameter to load UsageIds. Valid values:
  • true - Load all UsageIds. This is potentially very expensive, as there could be many UsageIds defined for the tenant which are not relevant to the current application.
  • false - Do not load any UsageIds.
  • string - A single non-empty string which defines the name of the requested UsageId.
  • string[] - An array of non-empty strings which define the names of requested UsageIds.
includeUsageId.helpDescription:
Optional parameter to load UsageIds. Valid values:
  • true - Load all UsageIds. This is potentially very expensive, as there could be many UsageIds defined for the tenant which are not relevant to the current application.
  • false - Do not load any UsageIds.
  • string - A single non-empty string which defines the name of the requested UsageId.
  • string[] - An array of non-empty strings which define the names of requested UsageIds.

bindingContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

localMatrix.description: The local transformation matrix of the node created for this content resource.
localMatrix.helpDescription: The local transformation matrix of the node created for this content resource.

metadataContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected. The special setting is only for internal use.

activateView.description: Optional parameter with view id which shall be activated when scene is loaded.
activateView.helpDescription: Optional parameter with view id which shall be activated when scene is loaded.

sourceType.description:
The source type of the content resource. Valid types:
  • vds
  • vds4
  • vds4-2d
  • svg
  • png
  • jpg
  • jpeg
  • gif
  • bmp
  • tif
  • tiff
  • stream
  • stream2d
  • ecad
  • pdf
  • auto
The source type may be omitted if this is a grouping content node.

If the source property points to an IPD Visualization service the sourceType property can be assigned value auto. The actual sourceType property will be detected by making a request to the backend.

NOTE: The tif and tiff image formats are not supported on all browsers. Source type "vds" initializes deprecated DVL namespace and uses legacy library to load and display VDS file content. If source type of "vds4" is used then new namespace based on Threejs rendering model will be used to load and display VDS file content. Since DVL namespace is deprecated in one of future releases it will be removed and source type "vds" will also use Threejs model.

The source type may be omitted if this is a grouping content node.

If the source property points to an IPD Visualization service the sourceType property can be assigned value auto. The actual sourceType property will be detected by making a request to the backend.

NOTE: The tif and tiff image formats are not supported on all browsers. Source type "vds" initializes deprecated DVL namespace and uses legacy library to load and display VDS file content. If source type of "vds4" is used then new namespace based on Threejs rendering model will be used to load and display VDS file content. Since DVL namespace is deprecated in one of future releases it will be removed and source type "vds" will also use Threejs model.

UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

tooltip.helpDescription: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

sap.ui.vk.tools.TooltipTool.description: The TooltipTool allows applications to display custom tooltip text on top of 3D object over which pointer is hovering
sap.ui.vk.tools.TooltipTool.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new TooltipTool. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getFollowCursor followCursor} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAnimate animate} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getOffsetX offsetX} : float (default: 10)
    • {@link #getOffsetY offsetY} : float (default: 15)
    • {@link #getTimeout timeout} : int (default: 0)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:hover hover} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool#constructor sap.ui.vk.tools.Tool} can be used as well.
sap.ui.vk.tools.TooltipTool.helpDescription: The TooltipTool allows applications to display custom tooltip text on top of 3D object over which pointer is hovering

sap.ui.vk.RedlineElementText.description: Provides a control for creating text redline elements.
sap.ui.vk.RedlineElementText.constructorDescription:
Redline element control for text. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getText text} : string (default: "Text")
    • {@link #getFont font} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getFontSize fontSize} : float (default: 32)
    • {@link #getFillColor fillColor} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: "rgba(0,0,0,0)")
    • {@link #getWidth width} : float (default: 300)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : float (default: 0)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.RedlineElement#constructor sap.ui.vk.RedlineElement} can be used as well.
sap.ui.vk.RedlineElementText.helpDescription: Provides a control for creating text redline elements.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

sap.ui.vk.ViewGroup.description: Provides the interface for the view group.
sap.ui.vk.ViewGroup.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new View Group. The objects of this class contain necessary information about View Group Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getViewGroupId viewGroupId} : string
    • {@link #getName name} : string
    • {@link #getDescription description} : string
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor sap.ui.base.ManagedObject} can be used as well.

sap.ui.vk.RedlineSurface.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new RedlineSurface. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getVirtualLeft virtualLeft} : float
    • {@link #getVirtualTop virtualTop} : float
    • {@link #getVirtualSideLength virtualSideLength} : float
    • {@link #getPanningRatio panningRatio} : float (default: 1)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getRedlineElements redlineElements} : sap.ui.vk.RedlineElement[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:pan pan} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:zoom zoom} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.vk.RedlineSurface.helpDescription: Provides a bass class control for redlining.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

sap.ui.vk.RedlineElementRectangle.description: Provides a control for creating rectangle redline elements.
sap.ui.vk.RedlineElementRectangle.constructorDescription:
Redline element control for rectangle. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : float (default: 0.001)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : float (default: 0.001)
    • {@link #getFillColor fillColor} : sap.ui.core.CSSColor (default: "rgba(0, 0, 0, 0)")
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.RedlineElement#constructor sap.ui.vk.RedlineElement} can be used as well.
sap.ui.vk.RedlineElementRectangle.helpDescription: Provides a control for creating rectangle redline elements.

sap.ui.vk.MapContainer.description: Abstract Constructor for a new Container.
sap.ui.vk.MapContainer.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new MapContainer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowNavbar showNavbar} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowHome showHome} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowMapLayer showMapLayer} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowRectangularZoom showRectangularZoom} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowZoom showZoom} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getListPanelStack listPanelStack} : sap.ui.vk.ListPanelStack
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.vk.ContainerBase#constructor sap.ui.vk.ContainerBase} can be used as well.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used.
